name: The Tyrant
overview: A force that seeks certainty through control.
growthPrompt: What are you afraid would happen if you let go?

lore.short: The Tyrant rules to silence fear.
lore.long: Tyrants are born from terror of disorder. Their tragedy is believing control equals safety.

name: The Martyr
overview: One who erases themselves to be needed.
growthPrompt: What do you gain by being indispensable?

lore.short: The Martyr bleeds so others may stay comfortable.
lore.long: Martyrs call suffering noble until resentment poisons everything they touch.

name: The Voidwalker
overview: An escape into absence when pain feels inevitable.
growthPrompt: What are you refusing to feel?

lore.short: The Voidwalker survives by vanishing.
lore.long: Detachment protects — until it becomes erasure. Voidwalkers must relearn presence.

name: The Perfection Cage
overview: A prison built from impossible standards.
growthPrompt: Who taught you that mistakes are unsafe?

lore.short: The cage is invisible — until you try to move.
lore.long: Perfectionism is fear dressed as discipline. Freedom begins with imperfection.

name: The Manipulator
overview: A strategist who avoids vulnerability through control.
growthPrompt: What would honesty cost you?

lore.short: The Manipulator never plays fair — even with themselves.
lore.long: Manipulators fear rejection more than loneliness. Truth is their greatest risk.

name: The Usurper
growthPrompt: What truth would soften entitlement without shattering you?

lore.short: The Usurper arrives quietly, like ink spreading in water.
lore.long: In the Eirden canon, The Usurper is not “evil” — it is a survival strategy that outlived its moment.
